title: Costs of external consequences of cyber attacks on businesses 2018
summary: This is a bar chart representing Category in the x axis and Cost in million U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The Cost in million U.S. dollars is highest at Category Information loss and lowest at Category Revenue loss.
There is a difference of 5.4 between the maximum Category Information loss and minimum Category Revenue loss.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Cost in million U.S. dollars for 4 number of Categorys.
The maximum Cost in million U.S. dollars 5.9 is found at Category Information loss and the minimum is found at Revenue loss where Category is 0.5.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Category in the x axis and Cost in million U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The Cost in million U.S. dollars is highest at Category Information loss and lowest at Category Revenue loss.
There is a difference of 5.4 between the maximum Category Information loss and minimum Category Revenue loss.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Category in the x axis and Cost in million U.S. dollars in the y axis.
Category Information loss has the highest Cost in million U.S. dollars and Revenue loss has the lowest Cost in million U.S. dollars.
The highest Category Information loss has 5.4 more Cost in million U.S. dollars than the lowest Category Revenue loss.
The Category Information loss has the highest Cost in million U.S. dollars, followed by Business disruption, and Equipment damages. Down to the Category Revenue loss which is the lowest.
The Category Revenue loss has 1.82 times less Cost in million U.S. dollars than average.
